result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas R. Recore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: RN & SDCL letter, remailed to new address

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas R. Recore
Current: W9484 County Road JJ, Wautoma, WI 54982-8300 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2017)
Prior: 259 Thackery Street, Redgranite, WI 54970

Case Called @ 10:02 AM: Defendant Thomas R. Recore in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  State's for the record that there may have been prior representation of Def.  Def agrees to proceed today and Court accepts waiver of any potential conflict.  Resolution recited by DA.  Def agrees with State's recital.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  State confirms that compliance with animal was achieved.  The Court: Imposes 5 days WCJ, GT and Huber, no TS credit, Report: 3/1/2016 at 8:00 pm; Court Costs and DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

Pre-trial conference at 01-14-2016 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-26-2016 10:00 am.

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department. Defendant may not harbor any dogs with the exception of the chocolate lab/pit bull mix named Willow. Willow must be completely vaccinated and proof of vaccination must be at the defendant's immediate disposal at the residence should the authorities attempt to verify.

Case called @ 2:07 p.m. Defendant Thomas R. Recore in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant waives his right to counsel at this time.  NGP entered.  Court orders $1500 Sig Bond. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding bond. Statement by DE.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
